thread.title: 'This is the excuse you've been waiting for!' SNP MP shredded over Scottish referendum
thread.title_full: 'This is the excuse you've been waiting for!' SNP MP shredded over Scottish referendum

title: 'This is the excuse you've been waiting for!' SNP MP shredded over Scottish referendum
text:
'This is the excuse you've been waiting for!' SNP MP shredded over Scottish referendum 'This is the excuse you've been waiting for!' SNP MP shredded over Scottish referendum STEPHEN GETHINS clashed with a BBC host after the SNP MP backed Nicola Sturgeon’s plans for a second Scottish independence referendum. PUBLISHED: 15:01,   15:03, Mon, Mar 13, 2017 
The First Minister announced that she would ask the Scottish Parliament for permission to request a Section 30 order, allowing an independence referendum. 
Daily Politics host Jo Coburn described Ms Sturgeon’s plans to trigger another independence referendum as “presumptive”. 
She fumed: “The negotiations haven’t even started, you don’t know whether there is going to be necessarily a hard-Tory Brexit as you call it. 
“A deal has not yet been put, to either parts of parliament. BBC Coburn fumed at Gethins as the independence campaign quickly launched their website Related articles Ruth Davidson FURIOUS over Nicola Sturgeon's latest independence vote 
“So having already have a website running, Indy2, website by the SNP, all looks and smacks like you’ve had this long prepared. 
“This is the moment you have been waiting for, the excuse you have been waiting for, to launch the process for another referendum, otherwise why have you already got a website already to go.” 
The Scottish politician argued back claiming that the First Ministers compromised plans had been ignored since the referendum. 
He said: “Well it doesn’t take all that long to build a website, Jo. 
“We have had nine months since June 23 referendum, now during those months we are seeing a huge amount of uncertainty for business. 
“We are seeing a huge amount of uncertainty for universities. BBC Stephen Gethins clashed with Jo Coburn has Sturgeon has paved the way for another referendum This is the moment you have been waiting for, the excuse you have been waiting for Jo Coburn 
“We have seen the only substantial piece of work to come from a government is the Scottish governments compromise, which has been undermined by the UK government. 
“It is right that the First Minister sets out the options that the people of Scotland now have.” 
Mr Gethins suggested that the Scottish people had the choice to avoid a “hard Tory Brexit ”. 
He said: “I think it’s important that the people of Scotland are given a choice, and given that Article 50 looks increasingly likely that it’s going to be triggered, I think the people of Scotland need to know, what there options are. 
“They need to be able to make a choice between two futures, there’s an increasingly isolationist future with the United Kingdom, or is it, securing our relationship with our partners in Europe.” Nicola Sturgeon's most memorable quotes Wed, March 8, 2017
